Class MazeController

java.lang.Object
fr.connexe.ui.MazeController
public class MazeController extends Object

Controller to display any Maze related operations on the view (creation, editing, solving, etc...)

Also handles game sessions displayed on top of the maze, with the beginGame(fr.connexe.ui.game.GameStartConfig) and stopGame() methods.

  • Property Summary

    Properties
    Type
    Property
    Description
    BooleanProperty
    gameRunning
    Returns a property indicating if a game's currently running or not.

  • Property Details

    • gameRunning

      public BooleanProperty gameRunningProperty
      Returns a property indicating if a game's currently running or not.
      See Also:
      • isGameRunning()
      • gameRunningProperty()

  • Constructor Details

    • MazeController

      public MazeController()

      Creates a new MazeController.

      This constructor is used by JavaFX when loading the FXML file.

  • Method Details

    • createMazeFX

      public void createMazeFX()
      Display a maze in the VBox of the main scene. If an arcade game is running, stops it immediately.

    • playStepByStepGeneration

      public void playStepByStepGeneration(Supplier<Double> delaySupplier, Runnable onFinished)
      Replays the generation of the maze step by step as an animation
      Parameters:
      delaySupplier - supplier to provide the delay between frames (in ms) (= speed) dynamically on demand, as the speed might change during the animation so it is necessary to query it each time
      onFinished - piece of code to run later when the animation is finished. Used to re-enable buttons.

    • buildSolutionPath

      public void buildSolutionPath(long executionTime)
      Build the solution path of the selected algorithm in the SolveMazeController Display the stats of the chosen solving algorithm (solving algorithm execution time, number of cells in path, number of visited cells)
      Parameters:
      executionTime - execution time of the solving method

    • playStepByStepSolution

      public void playStepByStepSolution(Supplier<Double> delaySupplier, Runnable onFinished)
      Play step by step animation of the solving algorithm
      Parameters:
      delaySupplier - supplier to provide the delay between frames (in ms) (= speed) dynamically on demand, as the speed might change during the animation so it is necessary to query it each time
      onFinished - piece of code to run later when the animation is finished. Used to re-enable buttons.

    • endCurrentAnimation

      public void endCurrentAnimation()
      End the current running animation and display the end view If the current running animation was the maze generation, display the end maze If the current running animation was the solving, show the end result with the path found and visited cells colored

    • saveMaze

      public void saveMaze(File file) throws MazeSerializationException, IOException
      Saves the current rendered maze into a file
      Parameters:
      file - file to save the maze to
      Throws:
      MazeSerializationException - when the maze failed to be serialized
      IOException - when the file can't be written

    • loadMaze

      public void loadMaze(File file) throws MazeSerializationException, IOException
      Loads a file containing maze data and renders it on the view
      Parameters:
      file - file to load in the view
      Throws:
      MazeSerializationException - when the maze failed to be serialized
      IOException - when the file can't be written

    • beginGame

      public void beginGame(GameStartConfig config) throws IncompatibleMazeException
      Begins a new game session with the current maze.
      Parameters:
      config - players and chosen game modes for the game
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when there's no maze loaded
      IncompatibleMazeException - when the maze's topology is incompatible with the given game mode (no path from A to B)

    • stopGame

      public void stopGame()
      Stops the ongoing game session and removes the overlay. Does nothing if no game's running.

    • setInputHubs

      public void setInputHubs(KeyboardHub keyboardHub, ControllerHub controllerHub)
      Sets keyboard and controller hubs to receive input from. Must be called when preparing the maze controller.
      Parameters:
      keyboardHub - keyboard hub to receive input from
      controllerHub - controller hub to receive input from

    • setMazeRenderer

      public void setMazeRenderer(MazeRenderer mazeRenderer)
      Sets the maze renderer to use for this controller. Called every time a maze is created or loaded.
      Parameters:
      mazeRenderer - the maze renderer to use

    • getMazeRenderer

      public MazeRenderer getMazeRenderer()
      Returns the maze renderer used by this controller.
      Returns:
      the maze renderer used by this controller

    • getStepByStepPath

      public List<Stack<Integer>> getStepByStepPath()
      Returns the last computed step-by-step path created by a maze-solving algorithm.
      Returns:
      the last computed step-by-step path

    • setStepByStepPath

      public void setStepByStepPath(List<Stack<Integer>> stepByStepPath)
      Sets the step-by-step path created by a maze-solving algorithm.
      Parameters:
      stepByStepPath - the step-by-step path to set

    • setDFS

      public void setDFS(boolean DFS)
      Sets whether or not the last step-by-step path was computed using a DFS algorithm.
      Parameters:
      DFS - true when the last algo was a DFS algorithm, false otherwise

    • gameRunningProperty

      public BooleanProperty gameRunningProperty()
      Returns a property indicating if a game's currently running or not.
      Returns:
      a property indicating if a game's currently running or not.
      See Also:
      • isGameRunning()

    • isGameRunning

      public boolean isGameRunning()
      Returns whether a game is currently running or not.
      Returns:
      true if a game is currently running, false otherwise.

    • getUniqueVisitedNodeCount

      public int getUniqueVisitedNodeCount(List<Stack<Integer>> stepByStepPath)
      Flatten a List<Stack> to a Set and get the total number of visited nodes of a step by step algorithm
      Parameters:
      stepByStepPath - the list of stacks (paths) to flatten
      Returns:
      total number of visited nodes of the List<Stack<Integer>> step by step solving history
